title: c_(programming_language)
body:
C is a general-purpose programming language that was designed with portability in mind. It has attained significant influence since its creation, spawning an entire family of languages inspired by its syntax.

It was created in the 1970s by Dennis Ritchie, and has since become one of the most popular languages. Today, it is still widely used for operating system kernels and device drivers.

Some of the languages it has inspired include [[C++ (programming_language)|]], [[Java (programming_language)|]], [[JavaScript]], [[c sharp (programming_language)|C#]], and [[PHP (programming_language)|]].

title: uwabaki
body:
Uwabaki(上履き, meaning 'indoor shoes') is the Japanese indoor [[shoes]] where outdoor shoes are prohibited, such as in schools, in gyms or some offices. 

Often considered as school indoor shoes made of white cloth and colored rubber often with a same-colored toe and shoe sole that sometimes indicates the grade, These are usually (but not always) in a style similar to [[mary janes]]. Students change their outdoor shoes into uwabaki at the [[getabako]]s when they enter the school.

Not to be confused with [[loafers]] which is worn quite often with school uniforms, but it is not indoor shoes.

h4. Examples

* !post #1536420
* !post #7095024
* !post #7242909: Left is uwabaki, right is [[loafers]]
* !post #6584459: Left is [[mary janes]], right is uwabaki

h4. See also
* [[loafers]]
* [[mary janes]]

title: clothes_focus
body:
Images focused on clothing or headwear, a subtype of [[object focus]]. Images usually have [[no humans]]. Some images may feature humans, but still focus on clothes by either doing [[close-up]]s of the garments/footwear or showing off various outfits, drawing the viewers attention mainly onto the clothes worn, rather than the wearer. The wearers [[head out of frame|head being out of frame]] can help to draw attention to the clothing.

If the focus is on shoes use [[footwear focus]] instead.

title: fold-over_collar
body:
Any [[collar]] that overlaps one side over the other. Not to be confused with the  folded-down [[wing collar]].

This does not include traditional garments that have fold-over collars by default, as seen in clothing such as [[japanese clothes|Japanese]] [[kimono]]s, [[Chinese clothes|Chinese]] [[hanfu]], [[Korean clothes|Korean]] [[hanbok]] et cetera.

It may, however, be seen in garments that fuse elements of East Asian clothing with other fashion types, such as with [[wa lolita|wa]] and [[qi lolita]].

h4. Examples

* !post #5691317: A fold-over [[detached collar]] 
* !post #5619109: On a [[dress]]
* !post #4656918: On a [[leather jacket]]

h4. See also

* [[Criss-cross halter]]

title: hokuto_no_ken:_shinpan_no_sousousei_kengou_retsuden
body:
[b]Hokuto no Ken: Shinpan no Sousousei Kengo Retsuden[/b] ([b]北斗の拳 ～審判の双蒼星 拳豪列伝～[/b], literally [i]Fist of the North Star - Judgement of the Twin Blue Stars - Fighters Assemble[/i]), known in the west simply as [b][[hokuto no ken|Fist of the North Star]][/b], is a 2D competitive [[fighting game]] produced by [[Sega]] and developed by [[Arc System Works]], based on the manga series of the same name.

One of the most memorable and entertaining [i]kusoge[/i] ever made. Primarily due to each character featuring various bizarre and over-the-top movesets adapted from various part of the anime (such as [[Souther]] being able to drop the [[Seitei Jujiryou|Holy Cross pyramid]]'s apex stone at the opponent or [[Jagi]] can force the opponent to "[[Say my name|say his name]]"), along with every character being able to achieve infinite combo.

title: doolittle_raid
body:
An air raid campaign on 18 April 1942 conducted by the [[United States Navy]] against the Japanese capital of [[Tokyo]] during [[World War II]]. The raid was named after the then-lieutenant colonel [[Jimmy Doolittle]], who planned and led the operation. It served as an initial retaliation for the Attack on [[Pearl Harbor]] four months prior.

The raid was conducted using 16 [[B-25 Mitchell]] medium bombers launched from the [[aircraft carrier]] [[USS Hornet (CV-8)]]. The attack was conceived as a one-way trip, as the Mitchells would not be able to return to the USN carrier fleet to conceal their position and instead they will be landed in areas controlled by the [[Kuomintang]]-controlled [[China]] for extraction.

While the raid caused minimal damage to the Japanese, it provided significant moral and propaganda victory for the US, as the raid demonstrated that the Japanese home island is not safe from attack. This would ended up being one of the contributing factor for the Imperial Japanese Navy to attack the Midway island, resulting in the [[Battle of Midway]].

title: creeper_(tool)
body:
A car [b]creeper[/b] is a four-wheeled platform that is used by [[mechanic]]s to comfortably lay their backs on, so that they can easily slide in or out of the underside of a [[motor vehicle]] (usually a car), to allowed them to perform inspection or [[maintenance]] under the vehicle. They can be mostly found in [[garage]]s and car repair shops.

title: navy_seal_copypasta_(meme)
body:
A notorious copypasta about a self-proclaimed "[[Navy SEALs|Navy SEAL]]" threatening an internet user with his supposed feats and connections.

[quote]What the fuck did you just fucking say about me, you little bitch? I'll have you know I graduated top of my class in the Navy Seals, and I've been involved in numerous secret raids on Al-Quaeda, and I have over 300 confirmed kills. I am trained in gorilla warfare and I'm the top sniper in the entire US armed forces. You are nothing to me but just another target. I will wipe you the fuck out with precision the likes of which has never been seen before on this Earth, mark my fucking words. You think you can get away with saying that shit to me over the Internet? Think again, fucker. As we speak I am contacting my secret network of spies across the USA and your IP is being traced right now so you better prepare for the storm, maggot. The storm that wipes out the pathetic little thing you call your life. You're fucking dead, kid. I can be anywhere, anytime, and I can kill you in over seven hundred ways, and that's just with my bare hands. Not only am I extensively trained in unarmed combat, but I have access to the entire arsenal of the United States Marine Corps and I will use it to its full extent to wipe your miserable ass off the face of the continent, you little shit. If only you could have known what unholy retribution your little "clever" comment was about to bring down upon you, maybe you would have held your fucking tongue. But you couldn't, you didn't, and now you're paying the price, you goddamn idiot. I will shit fury all over you and you will drown in it. You're fucking dead, kiddo.[/quote]

title: suenaga_mirai
body:
[quote]
[[Danny Choo]] said:

Mirai Suenaga (末永みらい) is the site [[mascot]] character for [[Culture Japan]] (dannychoo.com) who I developed with illustrator [[azami_yuuko|Azami Yuko]]. Mirai started off as a single illustration in the corner of the site back in 2007 and since then has gained much popularity worldwide.

There has been many Mirai collaboration projects with Japanese companies such as Good Smile Company, Cospa, [[nitroplus|Nitro Plus]], [[Kadokawa]], King Records and more.

The kanji of her name is 末永未来 but "Mirai" is written as Hiragana. Her name means "Eternal Future".
[/quote]

Mirai has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[twin braids]] and an [[ahoge]]. 

[[Suenaga Haruka]] is her younger sister.

h4. Profile
From [1]
[quote]Name: Mirai Suenaga
Japanese Name: 末永みらい (すえながみらい)
Birthday: March 3rd
Height: 165cm
3 size: B86cm W58cm H85cm
Age: Forever sweet 17
Blood type: -Unknown- (has rare DNA)

Mirai Suenaga is the main character of [[Mirai Millennium]]. She is a 2nd year high-school student at Asakusa Metropolitan High School a covert member of the Solar Marine Crimson Force. After classes, Mirai participates in the news club activities at school where she is both a newscaster and reporter. Mirai has a bit of a shy side but at heart she is a very reliable young girl. She has a strong curiosity and will follow it through to the end with adventurous spirit. Her favorite food is oranges, and her favorite color is also orange. Her dream is to become a camerawoman.
[/quote]


h4. See also

* [[Azami Yuuko]]
* [[Culture Japan]]
* [[Mirai Millennium]]

h4. External links

* [1] "Complete profile at [i]Culture Japan[/i]":http://www.dannychoo.com/post/en/1587/Mirai+Suenaga.html

body:
Fourth instalment of the Mad Max franchise released in 2015 after a three decade break. Has the most over the top vehicles. The movie was well received by both critics and fans and consider the most metal, feminist movie ever made.

A prequel movie, [[Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga]] was released in 2024 which tells the backstory of [[Imperator Furiosa]], one of the main characters of Fury Road.

title: superhero_landing
body:
A type of [[pose]] where a person lands from a jump touching the ground with one knee, the sole of the other leg's foot and an open palm or fist. This has alternately been known as a "superhero landing" thanks to the 2016 [[Deadpool_(movie)|Deadpool]] film pointing out how often it is done in superhero films.

title: tsubakuro_yume
body:
Character in [[Toji no Miko]]. One of four [[origami yukari|Yukari's]] bodyguards. A prodigy that show a childish personality appropriate for her age, also has a battle maniac mode. [spoiler]However a unknown disease struck her, making her bedridden for a long time until Yukari arrive and recruit her as her bodyguard. After a tense fight against [[etou kanami|Kanami]] in episode 11, she's exhausted and her health broke down. She passed away some time later [/spoiler]. Voiced by [[Minase Inori]].

She has a [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] styled in [[one side up]], and a [[grey eyes|grey]]/[[blue eyes]]. Her katana is Nikkari Ao'e and she use Ten'nen Rishin-Ryu as her fighting style.

title: teenage_mutant_ninja_turtles_(1987)
body:
The first animated series adaptation of the [[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles]]. It aired from 1987 to 1996, and ran for 10 seasons.

This series series follows the adventures of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles and their allies as they battle the Shredder, Krang, and numerous other villains and criminals. The property was changed considerably from the darker-toned [[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (Mirage Comics)|comics]], to make it more suitable for children and families.

The show was the first television appearance of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, and helped launch the characters into mainstream popularity, becoming one of the most popular animated series in television history. Action figures, breakfast cereals, plush toys, and other merchandise featuring the characters appeared on the market during the late 1980s and early 1990s and became top sellers worldwide. By 1990, the series was being shown daily on more than 125 television stations.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987 TV series)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teenage_Mutant_Ninja_Turtles_(1987_TV_series)]

title: teenage_mutant_ninja_turtles_(2012)
body:
The third animated series adaptation of the [[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles]], produced by [[Nickelodeon]]. It aired from 2012 to 2017, and ran for 5 seasons.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (2012 TV series)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teenage_Mutant_Ninja_Turtles_(2012_TV_series)]

title: teenage_mutant_ninja_turtles_(2003)
body:
The second animated series adaptation of the [[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles]], produced by [[4Kids|4Kids Entertainment]]. It aired from 2003 to 2010, and ran for 7 seasons.

Unlike the previous animated series, the 2003 series more closely matches the serious tone of the original comics, with a greater emphasis on action and themes of familial bonds. The series adapts a large scope of story arcs from the comics, with the Turtles' adventures combining elements of both fantasy and science fiction.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (2003 TV series)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teenage_Mutant_Ninja_Turtles_(2003_TV_series)]

title: hakan
body:
[b]Hakan[/b] is a character in the [[Street Fighter]] series. He made his debut as the tenth and final new fighter in [[street_fighter_iv_(series)|Super Street Fighter IV]].

Hakan is the president of the world's leading edible oil manufacturer and a leader in Turkey's national sport of Yağlı güreş. He enters the S.I.N. tournament to showcase his skills, while also traveling the world in search of inspiration for a new oil recipe.

During the tournament, Hakan encounters his old friend, [[e. honda|E. Honda]]. Their meeting gets competitive when each claims that theirs is the best fighting style in the world, and a match ensues. Honda loses and acknowledges that it was a good fight, but warns Hakan not to expect him to lose next time as he leaves. Hakan then muses that Japan has a number of different oils, and tells his family that they are heading to Japan to expand their business.

title: e._honda
body: [b]Edmond Honda[/b] or [b]E. Honda[/b] is a character of the [[Street Fighter]] series, first starring in [[Street Fighter II (series)|]]. An [i]ozeki[/i]-ranked [[sumo]] wrestler from Japan

title: killing_of_brian_thompson
body:
On December 4, 2024, United Healthcare CEO [[Brian Thompson]] was shot and killed in a targeted assassination outside of his New York hotel. The accused killer, tentatively identified as [[Luigi Mangione]], had written the words "deny," "defend," and "depose" on the bullets, prompting a wave of support from online commentators frustrated with the American healthcare system.

h4. See also

* [[Luigi Mangione]]
* [[Delay Deny Defend]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Killing of Brian Thompson":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Killing_of_Brian_Thompson]

title: delay_deny_defend
body:
[i]Delay, Deny, Defend: Why Insurance Companies Don't Pay Claims and What You Can Do About It[/i] is a 2010 book by Rutgers Law School professor Jay M. Feinman. It is a critical exploration of how the property and casualty insurance industry prioritizes profits over policyholders' needs, often using tactics like delaying or denying legitimate claims to bolster financial performance.

h4. See also

* [[Killing of Brian Thompson]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Delay, Deny, Defend":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delay%2C_Deny%2C_Defend]

title: 2024_attempted_assassination_of_donald_trump
body:
An assassination attempt targeting the former [[United States]] president [[Donald Trump]] at a 2024 Republican party election campaign rally in Butler, Pennsylvania on July 13, 2024.

Trump was shot at while giving a speech and survived the attack with minor injury, apparently sustaining a wound near his right ear and defiantly pumping his fist in the air as he was taken away by his security detail. The shooter, 20 years old Thomas Matthew Crooks, was killed by a Secret Service Counter Assault Team sniper shortly after the assassination attempt. Another attendee was also killed by Crooks as well.

The photographs of Trump [[raised_fist|raising his fist]] with an [[American flag]] floating in the background became a subject of [[meme]]s, either in  [[politics|political]] support of Trump or as [[satire]] related to the event. 

h4. Images

* !asset #22198394
* !asset #22199718

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Attempted assassination of Donald Trump in Florida":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Attempted_assassination_of_Donald_Trump_in_Florida

title: shidou_maki_(toji_no_miko)
body:
Character in [[Toji no Miko]]. One of four [[origami yukari|Yukari's]] bodyguards. A tomboy girl that serves loyalty to Origami's family, but can easily lose composure if she thinks she failed in her duty. Voiced by [[Uchiyama Yumi]].

She has a [[short hair|short]] [[orange hair|orange]]/[[brown hair]] with a [[braided sidelock]], [[orange eyes]], and a [[bandaged arm|bandaged arms]]. Her katana is Hoemaru and she use Shindou Munen-Ryu as her fighting style.

title: origami_yukari
body:
Antagonist in the first cour of [[Toji no Miko]]. Head of the prestigious family that oversees the manufacturing process of katana, and considered by many as the hero of Great Disaster of Sagami Bay that happen 20 years prior to this series. [spoiler]But actually she was possesed by [[Tagitsuhime]] in exchange for life of [[juujou kagari|her]] [[etou minato|friends]], that explains her youthful look. Tagitsuhime using her as human puppet until being defeated by [[juujou hiyori|Hiyori]] and [[etou kanami|Kanami]] on episode 12, freeing her consciousness[/spoiler]. Voiced by [[Seto Asami]].
 
She has a [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] with [[hair over one eye|hair over her right eye]], [[red eyes|red]] or [[orange eyes]]. Her katana are Okanehira and Doujigiri Yasutsuna. She use Niten Ichi-ryu as her fighting style.

title: giuseppe_garibaldi_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the Italian cruiser [i]Giuseppe Garibaldi[/i]. Character design by [[Jiji (aardvark)|]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[pink hair]], [[pink eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default (and only) outfit consists of a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[red shirt]] top with [[armpit cutout]]s and an [[aiguillette]], [[white shirt|white]] undershirt for the bust, [[white hat|white]] [[mini hat|mini]] [[shako cap]] resembling her real-life bridge, [[red skirt]], [[red footwear|red]] [[knee boots]], and [[white gloves]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces with the [[Regia Marina]]'s red-white stripes, four 152 mm triple/twin gun mounts with liferafts on top, and 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]].

title: mini_nobu_(fate)
body:
[[Chibi]] versions of [[Oda Nobunaga (koha-ace)|]] illustrated in [[Keikenchi]]'s [[Keikenchi (style)|style]], seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s GUDAGUDA-themed events as comic relief NPCs and enemies. It's origin is of Nobunaga's sub-consciousness when she made contact with the Imperial Grail. They can only say the word, "Nobu," and while they are weak individually, they are effective when working as a mob. There are several variants of Mini Nobus such as the default, the giant-sized one, one riding in a UFO, another in a miniature tank, another as a robot with stretchable arms, another dressed like [[Elvis Presley]], and another dressed as a [[Shinsengumi]] swordsman.

This tag refers to the specific chibi variant. If you see a generic-looking chibi Nobunaga like post #2632470, do not use this tag.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6930357: All Mini Nobu variations as of GUDAGUDA Super Goryokaku

title: vimana_(fate)
body: A flying contraption passed down from Babylon to India and recorded in the two epic sagas, Ramayana and Mahabharata, that is owned by [[Gilgamesh (fate)|]] and contained within the [[Gate of Babylon (fate)|]]. In [[Fate/Zero]], Gilgamesh uses it to engage [[Berserker (fate/zero)|]]'s F-15J Fighter Jet. In [[Fate/Grand Order]], it is used as [[Arjuna Alter (fate)|]] base of operations in the Indian Lostbelt.

title: monohoshizao_(fate)
body: The [[sword]] carried by [[Sasaki Kojirou (Fate)|]] from [[Fate (series)|]], based on the sword used by the historical [[Sasaki Kojirou]], who is said to have died in a duel with [[Miyamoto Musashi]] in 1612. It boasts an unusually long and heavy blade for a Japanese sword, and it takes an extraordinary man to even draw it from its scabbard, much less wield it in combat.

title: mini_cu-chan_(fate)
body:
A [[Craft Essence (fate)|]] in [[Fate/Grand Order]] featuring a [[chibi]] variation of [[Cu Chulainn Alter (fate)|]]. It originally appeared in the game's [[Mahou Shoujo Kikou ~Prisma Codes~|Prisma Codes]] event. He also shows up in both [[anastasia (fate)|Anastasia]] and [[paris (fate)|Paris]]'s Valentine events, forming a rivalry with the dolls they give the protagonist.

This tag is specific to the chibi version seen in FGO. If he is depicted as a non-canon chibi (like post #2348112), don't use this tag. Also, do not add the [[Cu Chulainn Alter (fate)|]] tag if Mini-Cu is by himself. They are treated as separate characters and should only be tagged together if both are present in the image.

title: robocop
body:
A [[cyberpunk]] movie franchise about [[Robocop (character)|]], a recently-murdered [[police]] officer who is revived as a heavily-armored [[cyborg]].

h4. Movies

* [[RoboCop 1]]: An officer is murdered and turned into a product to fight crime for Detroit. Corruption plagues the company that rebuilt him.
* [[RoboCop 2]]: Omnicorp tries to improve on the original product, while Detroit faces a new drug problem- [i]Nuke[/i]
* [[RoboCop 3]]: [todo]
* [[RoboCop (2014)]]: A reboot following the same premise as the first movie, with a much more modern look than what people expected in the 80s.

h4. See also

* [[ED-209]]: A powerful but poorly-programmed robot put forward as an alternative to the RoboCops
* [[RoboCop (character)|]]: The title character
* [[Peter Weller]]: The actor who played RoboCop
* [[Auto-9]]: RoboCop's signature handgun
* [[Lady BattleCop]]: A Japanese film heavily inspired by RoboCop.

title: mr._rabbit_(white)_(rusty_lake)
body:
A character in the [[Rusty Lake]] series, first introduced in Rusty Lake Hotel as an easter egg, featured more extensively in later Cube Escape Birthday.

He is a [[rabbit boy|rabbit]] [[furry]] with [[white fur]]. His eyes are also solid [[black sclera|black]], with [[no pupils]].

He dresses [[formal clothes|formal]]ly, wearing a [[brown suit|brown]] [[business suit|business]] [[suit]], with a [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]], a [[black necktie|black]] [[necktie]], a pair of [[brown gloves|brown]] [[gloves]], and a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

Note that this Mr. Rabbit and the brown-furred Mr. Rabbit featured extensively in Rusty Lake Hotel are formally treated as separate characters on Danbooru due to plot ambiguity on whether the two are the same person or not. The other Mr. Rabbit can be found under [[Mr. Rabbit (Brown) (Rusty Lake)]].

h4. External links
* "Mr. Rabbit | Rusty Lake Wiki | Fandom":[https://rusty-lake.fandom.com/wiki/Mr._Rabbit]

A playable operator in [[arknights:_endfield|Arknights: Endfield]].

[quote]
Ember was an Oathkeeper Knight from the Northern Desolation who served a military organization known as the Order of Steel Oath. Guided by her commitment to the Final Tribulation, she visited the Civilization Band before accepting an invitation to join Endfield Industries.

Sometimes she engages in earnest discussions about combat techniques, as if she were still battling on the brutal northern front.

title: endministrator_(arknights)
body:
A playable main character in [[Arknights: Endfield]].

The Endministrator of Endfield Industries.

According to the historical records of Talos-II, the Endministrator stands as a key guardian who protected civilization on this planet and saved humanity from multiple catastrophic disasters. The Endmin's heroic deeds have given rise to many stories, tales, and even rumors.

However, the Endmin's identity remains elusive and only a handful of people have seen the legend in person.

title: banbi
body:
A type of [[hanfu]]; a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] shirt from [[Chinese clothes|China]]. 

It can have a variety of collar types, such as a [[fold-over collar]], a [[square neckline]], a [[round neckline]] or a [[mandarin collar]].

It is sometimes depicted being [[short over long sleeves|worn over]] a [[ruqun]] garment.

h4. Examples
* !asset #24448901
* !post #6026383

h4. Trivia
* The term translates roughly to 'half-arm'; it is also known as banxiu (Chinese: 半袖), meaning 'half-sleeves'. 
* The [[beizi_(clothing)|]], which typically has long sleeves, originated from the banbi. 
* Tha banbi can also be secured at the front either with ties or a metal button, such as the [[pankou]].

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Banbi":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Banbi

title: tanling_ruqun
body:

body:

For American Indians, use [[Native American]]. For East Indians, see the country tags of [[Indonesia]], [[Malaysia]], [[Singapore]], [[Thailand]], [[Cambodia]], [[Laos]], [[Vietnam]], and the [[Philippines]].

title: western_comics_(style)
body:
Images in the style of traditional American/western comic books. (Not simply images featuring comic book characters.)

Typical styles in western comics include that of [[jack kirby (style)|Jack Kirby]], Neal Adams, Steve Ditko, Frank Miller, George Perez, [[Alex Ross]], [[Jim Lee]], and Rob Liefeld. Features in those styles include [[halftone|halftone printing]], [[limited palette]]s, and text in [[English text|English]] or [[romaji text|romaji]].

h4. See also

* [[Toon (style)]]

title: food_on_foot

The former is food (cherries, biscuits, etc.) held by the character's toes and the latter is chocolate or black reflective fluid on the feet (if white consider using cum, cream or sugestive_fluid).

title: slavic_mythology
body:
The myths involving gods, heroes, monsters, etc. of the Slavic peoples. Most commonly, the myths of the East Slavs are depicted in art internationally, whether it be entities unique to them, or the variants of common Slavic entities domestic to them.

h4. Beings

h6. Monsters that appeared in/originated from Slavic Mythology

* [[Bauk]] (South Slavic)

h6. People, Heroes and named spirits

title: ded_moroz
body: A character from [[Slavic mythology]], originating as a personification of winter before becoming a character similar to Father Christmas and [[Santa Claus]] among the Slavs. Among East Slavs, whose version of the name is used for this tag, he is accompanied by [[Snegurochka (mythology)|]].

title: baba_yaga_(mythology)
body:
A witch from [[Slavic mythology]], often flying around in a mortar and living in a hut on chicken legs deep in the forest.

Included under this tag are similar baba witches which appear in Slavic myth, as Baba Yaga is commonly associated with East Slavs in specific, such as Ježibaba among the West Slavs and Baba Roga among the ex-Yugoslavs. Varyingly in myth, they are either presented as regional versions of Baba Yaga, or as her sisters/counterparts.

title: bauk
body: A bauk is a mythical creature from [[Slavic mythology|Serbian mythology]] that hides in dark places, waiting to grab and devour its victim.

title: shichinosato_kofuki
body:
Main character in [[Toji no Miko: Kizamishi Issen no Tomoshibi]] from [[Renpu girls school uniform|Renpu Girl's School]]. A straightforward girl that likes to move by herself, making her less skillful in teamwork tactics. Very fond of eradicating [[Aratama (toji no miko)|Aratama]] that even she dreamed of doing that. Voiced by [[Igarashi Hiromi]].

She has [[grey hair|grey]]/[[brown hair]], [[purple eyes]] and a [[hooded jacket|hooded]] [[sleeveless jacket]]. Her katana are Chatan Nakiri and Niou Kiyotsuna. She use Escrima (Arnis) as her fighting style.

body:

She has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]], [[grey eyes]] and usually wearing a [[green hairband|green]] [[polka dot hairband]]. Her katana is Renge Fudou Teruhiro and she use Bokuden-ryu as her fighting style.

body:

She sees [[etou kanami|Kanami]] as her domestic rival, but the latter doesn't feel the same. Voiced by [[Akaneya Himika]]. 

She has [[medium hair|medium]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[brown hair|brown]]-[[red hair]] styled in [[two side up]], [[brown eyes|brown]]/[[orange eyes]], and [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[black gloves]]. Her katana is Kashuu Kiyomitsu and she use Shingyoto-ryu as her fighting style.

title: mashiko_kaoru
body:
Main character in [[Toji no Miko]] from [[osafune girls academy school uniform|Osafune Girl's Academy]]. A sluggish and taciturn girl that always conserves her energy (partially because she use [[ootachi]] instead of usual [[katana]] used by other girls). Has a guardian youkai named [[nene (toji no miko)|Nene]] that always beside her. Voiced by [[Matsuda Risae]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] in [[twintails]] that [[hair ears|resembles a pair of dog ears]], [[purple eyes]], and a [[petite]] body. Her katana is Nenekirimaru and she use Yakumaru Jigen-Ryu as her fighting style.

title: itomi_sayaka
body:
Main character in [[Toji no Miko]] from [[Renpu girs school uniform|Renpu Girl's School]]. Looks like a quiet girl, but actually she has a hard time communicating with others. With [[yanase mai|Mai's]] help, she began showing more of her true feelings. Voiced by [[Kino Hina]]. 
 
She has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair|grey]]/[[white hair]] with an [[ahoge]], [[hair between eyes|bangs between her eyes]] and a  [[purple eyes]]. Her katana is Myoho Muramasa and she use Onoha Itto-Ryu as her fighting style.

title: exposed_bone
body:
When an otherwise/mostly intact person, animal or creature has bones that protrude through the skin or does not have an outer layer covering the bone(s). That outer layer may also be [[see-through body|transparent]].

This does [b]not[/b] include bones that are visible [b]through[/b] the skin. 

A fully visible [[skeleton]] does also [b]not[/b] fall under this tag, but should rather be tagged as [[skeleton]].

Exposed bone may or may not mean gore/[[guro]]. Many illustrations with this tag achieve the visible bones through magical or imaginary methods. X-ray can also be used to show bones. 

H4. Examples
* !post #8668848: exposed bone via [[see-through body]]
* !post #6302818: exposed bone via [[x-ray film]] 
* !post #7891845: exposed bone via no skin

title: peni_parker
body:
A young girl introduced as one of the many Spider Totems in [[Spider-Man (series)|]]'s [[Spider-Verse]] storyline. Based off several cyberpunk anime series like [[Akira (manga)|]], [[Serial Experiments Lain]] and [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], her role in her home universe is to pilot the giant mecha [[SP//dr]], which has taken a toll on her mental state.

An alternative version of her appears in the film [[Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse]], where she appears to be a younger and much cheerier high school student with SP//dr as a mini-mecha companion. Her design instead embraces the "[[moe (phrase)|]]" aesthetic, while still keeping some technological elements of her comics counterpart. Her later appearance in [[Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse]] has her looking much closer to her comic book appearance.

Peni's default outfit is a [[school uniform]] (a black [[sweater]] in the comics, a black [[sweater vest]] in the film), with a matching [[pleated skirt]]. She has messy [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]].

title: pronghorn
body: A species of artiodactyl mammal (like the deer) found in western and central North America. It is known as the second fastest land mammal in the world (or the fastest in the Western Hemisphere). Although slower than the African cheetah at top speed, it can sustain the high speeds much longer than cheetahs.

title: the_amazing_bag_man
body:
An alternate costume of [[Spider-Man]]. Consists of a [[Fantastic Four]] uniform and a paper bag as mask.
Peter originally wore this costume after getting rid of his [[symbiote]]-infested black costume at the Baxter Building, courtesy of [[Johnny Storm]] (along with a "kick me" sign).

The costume gained fame thanks to appearing in several Spider-Man videogames as an unlockable.

title: vesna_mikovic
body:
Character from [[Brave Witches]], hailing from Ostmark.

She was trained by [[Edytha Rossmann]] and had a short-lived romance with [[Waltrud Krupinski]]. She would later join the reformed [[507th Joint Fighter Wing]]. 
Her weapon is an MG34 machine gun, her familiar is a Croatian sheepdog, and she's based on Veca Micovič.

title: misumi_miya
body:
Character from [[Brave Witches]].

Introduced as [[Karibuchi Hikari]]'s rival cadet in episode 1, she would later go on to join the reformed [[507th Joint Fighter Wing]].

Her weapon is a Type 99-2 Model 2 Kai training rifle, and her familiar is a white cat.

title: kuroda_kunika
body:
Character from [[Noble Witches]]

A Flying officer from Fuso serving in the [[506th Joint Fighter Wing]]. From a branch family of a daimyou clan.

Her weapons are a Ho-103 machine gun and MG42. Her familiar is a shiba inu, and she's based on Kuroki Tameyoshi.

title: ed-209
body: The [b]E[/b]nforcement [b]D[/b]roid Series 209 is a heavily-armed but poorly-designed robot from the [[Robocop]] franchise. It is famously incapable of using stairs without losing its balance.

title: auto-9
body:
The signature [[weapon]] of the [[Robocop (character)|title character]] of the [[RoboCop]] film franchise. The Auto-9 prop was a modified [[Beretta 93R]] [b][[handgun|machine pistol]][/B], and it accepts 50-[[ammunition|round]] [[magazine (weapon)|]]s. 

Originally intended to be a modified [[Desert Eagle]] (which ended in the film as the sidearm of one of the villains), the Desert Eagle proved to appear too small in the hands of RoboCop, so the director opted to use the bigger looking modified Beretta instead.

h1. External links
* "RoboCop Wikia":https://robocop.fandom.com/wiki/Auto_9

title: peter_weller
body:
Peter Francis Weller (born June 24, 1947) is an American actor and television director.
He has appeared in more than 70 films and television series, including [[RoboCop]] (1987) and its sequel [[RoboCop 2]] (1990), in which he played the titular character; The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension (1984); and [[star trek: kelvin timeline|Star Trek Into Darkness]] (2013). He appeared in such films as Woody Allen's Mighty Aphrodite (1995), the Oliver Stone-produced The New Age (1994), and David Cronenberg's adaptation of William Burroughs's novel [[Naked Lunch]] (1991).

title: robocop_(character)
body:
Titular [[cyborg]] from [[Robocop|the franchise of the same name]]. Played by actor [[Peter Weller]]. Robocop is [spoilers][[police]] officer Alex Murphy, who was killed in the line of duty but promptly revived as a cyborg.[/spoilers]

The design of the character was actually inspired by [[Judge Dredd]], the comic "ROM":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rom_(comics)_ and several Japanese [[tokusatsu]] series from the early 80s like [[uchuu_keiji_gavan|Space Sheriff Gavan]] and the [[Metal Hero]] series.

title: naenia_(vanitas_no_carte)
body: Naenia (ネーニア, Nēnia) is a major antagonist from Jun Mochizuki's The Case Study of Vanitas. She is the mysterious ethereal entity responsible for infecting curse-bearing Vampires with Malnomen in a hunt for their True Names. She is a member of Charlatan, who help facilitate her creation of curse-bearers to yet unclear ends. As her goal and very existence is in direct opposition to that of Vanitas and Noé, who fight to cure curse-bearers, she and they remain in constant conflict for the duration of the series.

title: zarya_petrovic
body:
Zarya Petrovic (callsign "Skorpion", later "Icarus") is an OC created by LapisLumos in 2023 and first designed by [[Chen Feng (slbdofcl)|]].

She is an Albino Bosnian Serbian soldier belonging to the [[Scorpions (paramilitary)|Skorpions]] paramilitary group. She is usually depicted with a red [[beret]] and a [[kolovrat (symbol)|]] [[silver necklace|silver]] [[necklace]].

She was designed to be [[Alpha (Alpha 1918)|]]'s unofficial mother.

title: mitsubishi
body:
[b]Mitsubishi Group[/b] is a major Japanese conglomerate company, currently the largest company in [[Japan]].

Mitsubishi's history can be traced back to the Meiji era, where they were one of the first heavy industry company in Japan. The company became a major [i]zaibatsu[/i] company (Japanese word for major family-run business that held a large stake of the country's economy) during late 1900s, producing wide array of products. Ranging from pencil to warships.

Mitsubishi were split up in 1946, following [[World War II]] as a part of anti-trust policy by the occupying United States. They would later regrouped in 1950s, though each associated companies is largely independent from the main branch.

h4. Subsidiaries
* [[Mitsubishi Electric]]
* [[Mitsubishi Fusou]]
* [[Mitsubishi Heavy Industries]]
* [[Mitsubishi Motors]]

title: nazi
body:
A post displaying Nazi imagery, symbols or characters being adherent to Nazism; such as use of the [[Nazi flag]], the [[Nazi war ensign]] or the [[reichsadler]] featuring a [[swastika]].

Not to be used for mere depictions of the [[Wehrmacht]], [[Kriegsmarine]] or [[Luftwaffe]].

In some parts of the world it is illegal to display or advertise Nazi imagery, so [[censored symbol]]s such as sad emojis or X on an [[armband]] may be displayed to get around censorship or avoid attention. This tag includes those examples as well, as long as they are clear Nazi references.

h4. Nazi symbolism

title: american_civil_war
body:
A civil [[war]] between the North (Union) and South ([[Confederate States of America]]) of the [[United states|United States]], which lasted from 1861 to 1865. The war's cause was the issue of [[slave]]ry, in which the Southern Confederate states refused to abolish slavery and seceded from the Union.

body:

Infamous for their [[white hood]]s, burning crosses, lynchings and others murders.

title: confederate_states_of_america
body:
The [b]Confederate States of America (CSA)[/b] was a secessionist state that existed from 1861 to 1865, it was formed when a number of states from the [[United States]] of America decided to secede from the union in the name of State's rights to [[slave]]ry. Ultimately, a total of 11 states join the Confederacy. Not recognized by any major country during its brief existence.

Use this tag when the post directly refer to the CSA, such as its military during the [[American Civil War]]. Do not apply this tag if the post simply featuring the [[Confederate flag]] as a motif.

h4. See also
* [[American Civil War]]
* [[Confederate flag]]
* [[Ku Klux Klan]]

title: 9/11_tourist_guy_(meme)
body:
A hoax that featured a digitally altered photograph of a tourist on the observation deck of the [[World Trade Center]], supposedly on the day of the [[9/11|September 11 attacks]], showing a plane about to hit the tower in the background.

The photo became an Internet phenomenon as many manipulated pictures spread online. The man in the photograph was ultimately identified as Hungarian Péter Guzli, who took the photo in 1997. Guzli said he edited the photo as a joke for his friends and did not realize it would spread across the Internet.

h4.See also

* "Original hoax photo":https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/0/05/Tourist_guy.jpg

title: stepan_(number-seventeen)
body:
Stepan is a male Ukrainian character belonging to the 67th Mechanized Brigade, a [[Right Sector]]-derivative unit.

He is often depicted with a [[jacket]], [[baggy pants]], [[boots]], [[gloves]], and a [[blue beanie|blue]] [[beanie]]. His weapon of choice is an [[AK-47]].

Created by [[Biswapriya Purkayastha]] in 2022 to mock Ukrainian ultranationalists in the comic [i]Tales of Ukranazistan[/i] after the [[russo-ukrainian war|2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine]] began, his original full name was "Ukranazi Stepan". [[Marichka]]'s newfound notoriety on /pol/ inspired [[Number-Seventeen]] to draw Stepan as an aesthetically-appealing character to ship with her in a series of comics, with his rather-unbelievable backstory utterly unchanged. LapisLumos' and [[Linyvets chan]]'s contributions gave Stepan [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and greater depth, fully diverging the character from the original.

h4. External links

* "Marichka Wiki (English)":https://marichka.fandom.com/wiki/Stepan
* "Marichka Wiki (Ukrainian)":https://marichka.fandom.com/uk/wiki/%D0%A1%D1%82%D0%B5%D0%BF%D0%B0%D0%BD
* "Original Comic's Telegram":https://t.me/TalesOfUkranazistan
* "Original Author's Wordpress":https://ragheadthefiendlyterrorist.wordpress.com/
* "Original Author's Blogspot (inactive)":https://bill-purkayastha.blogspot.com/

title: hokkaido
body:
[b]Hokkaido[/b] is the largest prefecture in Japan and the largest of the northern islands. Its capital is [[Sapporo (city)|]].

h4. Locations

* [[Hakodate (city)|]]
* [[Otaru (hokkaido)|]]
* [[Sapporo (city)|]]
* [[Wakkanai]]

Shorthand for September 11, [[2001]]. A [[terrorism|terrorist attack]] involving two planes hijacked by Al-Qaeda [[terrorist]]s flew into the [[World Trade Center|Twin Towers]], causing them to collapse top-down onto the streets of [[New York City]]. Another plane was flown into the Pentagon building in Arlington, Virginia while a fourth, presumed to be targeting somewhere in [[Washington D.C.]] was deliberately crashed near Shanksville, Pennsylvania as its passengers fought to regain control from the terrorists. The death toll is currently at 2,996, including 17 hijackers.

The event is widely considered by Americans to be the true start of the 2000s, as well as a catalyst of the "War on Terror", a series of armed involvement of the US and allies in the middle east under the pretext of eliminating terrorism. Chief among these conflicts were as the [[War in Afghanistan|American invasion of Afghanistan in 2001]] and [[Iraq War|Iraq in 2003]], and to an extent, the [[Syrian Civil War]].

Due to various factors, the event has spawned numerous jokes and [[meme]]s. The earliest was about various conspiracy theory alleged that the event was an inside job orchestrated by then-US President [[george w. bush|George W. Bush]] as a [i]casus belli[/i] for the war in the middle east, such as "Bush did 9/11" and "jet fuel don't melt steel beams". Though later on, 9/11 imagery or reference has gained resurgence as a part of Gen Z humor, primarily for the shock value or as an "edgy" punchline.

The most common depiction of the event depicts [[smoke]] exiting either of the towers.

h4. See also

* [[9/11 tourist guy (meme)]]
* [[A second plane has hit the x (meme)]]
* [[War in Afghanistan]]
* [[Iraq War]]
* [[World Trade Center]]
* [[Osama Bin Laden]]
* [[Tag group:history]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: September 11 attacks":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/September_11_attacks]

title: dragonmaid_sheou
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 10
[b]Attribute:[/b] Light
[b]Type:[/b] Dragon / Fusion / Effect
[i]
1 "Dragonmaid" monster + 1 Level 5 or higher Dragon monster
During each Standby Phase: You can Special Summon 1 Level 9 or lower "Dragonmaid" monster from your hand or GY. When your opponent activates a card or effect (Quick Effect): You can negate the activation, and if you do, destroy that card, also, after that, return this card to the Extra Deck, and if you do, Special Summon 1 "House Dragonmaid" from your Extra Deck. You can only use each effect of "Dragonmaid Sheou" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 3500
[b]DEF:[/b] 2000


A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]] and one of the member of the Dragonmaid archetype. She is [[dragon]] form of [[House Dragonmaid]]. Unlike the other maid, [[Dragonmaid Sheou]] is currently the only bipedal dragon in the Dragonmaid archetype. She also has the highest Level (10) and original ATK (3500) of all Dragonmaid dragon form. Although Dragonmaid Sheou has Light attribute, her scale color is black, which is more likely Dark attribute monsters' color.
other_names: ドラゴンメイド・シュトラール

title: philia_regis
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 8
[b]Attribute:[/b] Dark
[b]Type:[/b] Dragon / Fusion / Effect
[i]
1 Dragon Fusion Monster + 1 Level 7 or higher Dragon monster
During the Main Phase (Quick Effect): You can target 1 card your opponent controls or in their GY; banish it, then, if it was banished from the field, return 1 Dragon monster you control to the hand. At the start of your opponent's Battle Phase, if this card is in your GY: You can return 1 Dragon monster you control to the hand/Extra Deck, and if you do, Special Summon this card. You can only use each effect of "Philia Regis" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 3000
[b]DEF:[/b] 2500

A new [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]] featured in the Alliance Insight core booster box. [[Philia Regis]] is likely an indirect support to Dragonmaid archetype, due to being a Dragon Fusion Monster with effects that rely on returning Dragon monsters from the field to the hand.

She is a parody of [[Hisui (cookie)|]], with a [[:3]] mouth and [[solid circle eyes]], very simple [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]], one hand doing a [[v]] with the other [[arm behind back|hand either behind her back]] or [[amputee|amputated]]. title: noel_vermillion
body:
Female character from [i][[BlazBlue]][/i].

Noel Vermillion is a lieutenant of the NOL (Novus Orbis Librarium), who dual-wields a set of handguns named Arcus Diabolus Bolverk. She works as a direct subordinate of Major [[Jin Kisaragi]].

Her hobbies include online shopping and poetry (she refuses to show others her poems). She deeply dislikes insects.

She [[dual wielding|wields]] the Nox Nyctores [[Bolverk]].

Voiced in Japanese by [[Kondou Kanako]] and English by [[Cristina Valenzuela]].

title: strike_witches
body:
[b]Strike Witches[/b] is a light novel and anime series set in an alternate [[World War II]] setting in which the nations of the world band together to defend against an alien invasion. Their only trump cards are witches (genderswapped versions of real life World War II fighter pilots) who don engine-shaped leggings known as [[striker unit]]s to fly and do battle in the sky. 

The series later spawned several sequels and spin-offs, which were later collectively named the [[World Witches Series]].

*Written by [[Yamaguchi Noboru]]

title: piranimon
body:
A vicious Aquatic Digimon that acts in large schools. The exoskeleton that covers Piranimon’s head enhances the power of its jaws, helping it to crush foes with its sharp fangs. The sheer power of its bite is said to rival Mammothmon’s stomp.
Piranimon uses Cruel Invitation to run through prey with its fishhook-like tail and drag them into the water. Then it clamps down on them with its bite and rapidly spins around with Calamity Vise, riddling their body with holes as it finishes them off. Since Piranimon target lone Digimon and attack in groups, they leave behind no trace of their prey’s data.

title: qixie
body:
[[Chinese clothes|Chinese]] [[platform footwear]] that originates from [[Manchu clothes|Manchu]]. Also called "Manchu platform shoes".

h4. Examples
* !post #8472299


h4. Trivia
* The shape of these heels can vary. There are types that imitate the thick, outward-curve shape of [[yuanbao]] (sycee). There is a shape that curves inwards like a 'horseshoe', and other shapes described as 'vase'-like or 'flowerpot'-like.

* Historically, unlike Han Chinese women, the aristocratic Manchu women of China did not bind their feet by tradition, but wore platformed shoes. There are several theories behind wearing this footwear, from keeping their clothing clean, to protecting their feet from insect bites.


h4. See also

* [[Paduka]] (Ancient Indian footwear)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Manchu Platform shoes":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manchu_platform_shoes]

title: weezer_(band)
body:
An American rock band formed in [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], in 1992. The [[band (music)|]] was founded by lead vocalist and guitarist Rivers Cuomo, alongside former bassist Matt Sharp, drummer Patrick Wilson, and former member Jason Cropper. Weezer gained popularity in the mid-1990s with their self-titled debut album, often referred to as the "Blue Album," which featured hit songs like "Buddy Holly," "Undone - The Sweater Song," and "Say It Ain't So."

Known for their catchy melodies, power-pop hooks, and a mix of alternative and pop-rock sound, Weezer has released several successful albums over the years. Some of their notable hits include "Hash Pipe," "Island in the Sun," "Beverly Hills," and "Pork and Beans." They have developed a devoted fanbase and have remained active in the music industry, releasing new music and touring consistently.

h4. Albums

* [[Weezer (Blue Album)]] (1994)
* [[Pinkerton (Weezer)|]] (1996)
* [[Weezer (Green Album)]] (2001)
* Maladroit (2002)

title: screentones
body:
Screentone is a technique for applying textures and shades to drawings, used as an alternative to [[hatching (texture)|]]. In the conventional process, patterns are transferred to paper from preprinted sheets, but the technique is also simulated in computer graphics, notably in Flipnote Studio and Macpaint.

[[Ben-Day dots]] is a type of screentone.

body:
An intergalactic peacekeeper typically associated with the Kree army. The title has been passed between several characters in the [[Marvel]] universe:

* [[Mar-Vell]] - the first Captain Marvel, deceased
* [[Monica Rambeau]] - the second Captain Marvel, becomes Photon and later Spectrum after conceding title
* Genis-Vell - the third Captain Marvel, became the second Photon, deceased
* Phylla-Vell - the fourth Captain Marvel, became Quasar and later Martyr, deceased
* Khn'nr - A Kree clone given Mar-Vell's memories and illness, deceased
* Noh-Varr - An alternate universe Kree soldier, became Protector and later Marvel Boy
* [[Carol Danvers]] - the fifth Captain Marvel (previously [[Ms. Marvel]]), currently holds the title

h4. See also

* [[Shazam]] - The original user of the name Captain Marvel 1939-2012

title: jabberwock_(fate)
body:
Jabberwocky:

The Jabberwock
And as in uffish thought he stood,
The Jabberwock, with eyes of flame,
Came whiffling through the tulgey wood,
And burbled as it came!

One, two! One, two! And through and through,
The vorpal blade went snicker-snack!
He left it dead, and with its head,
He went galumphing back.

(Jabberwocky by Lewis Carrol)

[[Nursery_Rhyme_(Fate)|Nursery Rhyme]] can summon the Jabberwock (ジャバウォック, Jabawokku?), a being she calls a "friend" that is greater in power than Servants. It is initially believed to be the Berserker-class Servant of Alice, and it has an overwhelming presence. It uses a skill called Alice Eater (ありすイーター, Arisu Ītā?) to temporarily strengthen itself.
Its strength shakes the Arena itself, and simply nearing it allows for its fierce, swirling magical power to be felt. It can overwhelmingly defeat Hakuno Kishinami's Servant, and the only defense is to retreat because Alice doesn't have it to pursue them due to wishing to wait for Hakuno to "play" with her. It is created through their power, and it will stay until its granted magical energy is depleted. In the Fate/EXTRA Manga, it was shown that while Saber and Lancer could damage the Jabberwocky, it simply regenerated from its injuries, even restoring its decapitated head with no issue.

It can only be defeated by the Vorpal Blade, a "blade of legend that no one has ever seen", a Mystic Code weapon that has an effect on certain types of monstrosities. It is from the poem Jabberwocky by Lewis Carrol, depicting a nameless hero's quest to slay the fearsome beast. It is not something found normally within the Moon Cell, but crafted by an alchemist with Malachite. The one created by Rani VIII is only able to be used once. It emanates magic as it nears the Jabberwock, shrinking his aura and allowing for him to be defeated in regular combat.

https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Nursery_Rhyme_(Noble_Phantasm)

body:
Izumi_Izumi (伊澄いずみ) is a character in Tokimeki_Idol. She is a member of the unit Cookie Paradise.

Izumi is a game-loving girl who dreams of being a nationally-recognized game idol. She’s extremely into retro games and is particularly good at shooting games. She is trying to make a name for herself as an idol in order to ask for the production of a sequel to the "Gradius" series. She has a deep knowledge of analogue games as well as digital ones. Many of her family members and relatives work in the video game industry. She says that she is "Working as a video game idol to avoid the future of video games disappearing."

title: tiger_ii
body:
A [[Germany|German]] heavy [[tank]] of [[World War II]]. The final official German designation was [b]Panzerkampfwagen Tiger Ausf. B[/b]. It is often referred to by the informal nickname "Royal Tiger" or "King Tiger", from the German "Königstiger". 

The Tiger II was the successor to the [[Tiger I]], combining the latter's thick armor with the armor sloping used on the [[Panther (tank)|]]. The tank weighed almost 70 metric tons, and was protected by 100 to 180 mm (3.9 to 7.1 in) of armor to the front. It was armed with the long barreled 8.8 cm KwK 43 L/71 gun. The chassis was also the basis for the [[Jagdtiger]] turretless [[tank destroyer]].

h4. See also
* [[Kurt Knispel]]
* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tiger II":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tiger_II

title: dfc-tan
body:
[[Original]] character belonging to an [[anonymous (4chan)|anonymous requester]] on [[4chan|4chan's]] /a/ board (Anime and Manga), featured in the [[drawfag]] threads. She is the [[personification|moe personification]] of the phrase "[b][[flat_chest|Delicious Flat Chest]][/b]," which is typically abbreviated as "[b]DFC[/b]."

* !post #8675619

Originally posted as an ordinary request, the original image, drawn by [[Ryotashi]], was posted in early [[2013]], gaining traction and notoriety among 4chan users and other niche anime communities. The character eventually became a minor [[meme]] and used as a common reaction image against large breast admirers.

Within a month of her popularity, her creator had another character created, [[DCT-tan]] ([b]Delicious Cow Tits[/b]), DFC's younger sister, an albino [[oppai loli]] [[polar opposites|foil]] who contrasted DFC-tan, specifically in regards to her chest size.

h4. See Also
* [[DCT-tan]]
* [[Drawfag]]
* [[Flat Chest]]

title: tucker_carlson
body:
Tucker Carlson is a political commentator and former TV host on [[Fox News]]. Since 2016, he was the host of his own show on Fox News, [I]Tucker Carlson Tonight[/I], where he was criticize for promoting conservative and right wing views and spreading racist news, bigotry rhetoric and false conspiracy theories. Eventually he was fired in 2023 and his show cancelled, as the higher ups on Fox felt Carlson was doing more harm than good to the company with his views and the host became too full of himself.

He became a joke in 2024 when Carlson went to Russia to interview with Russian President [[Vladimir Putin]], where he was mocked for being an out of touch rich guy (since Tucker is a member of the Swanson Family, who help create the [[TV Dinner]]) on things he thought were impressive in Russia when they were very common in the US and Europe, and his interview with Putin was considered lackluster since both men were trying to force their political views on each other with no success.

title: mid-boss_(disgaea)
body:
Mid-Boss, real name Vyers, is a character that has first debuted in the [[Disgaea]] and made several cameo appearances in the later sequels. He obtained the nickname "Mid-Boss" from Laharl, who deemed him unworthy of his title of "The Dark Adonis" (which is self-proclaimed) and is the unofficial rival of Laharl.

He is very kind and good-natured, despite being a demon, possesses a French accent, and is very cocky in his abilities which results with him constantly challenging [[Laharl]], [[Etna (disgaea)|]], and [[Flonne]]. It is later revealed [spoiler]that Mid-Boss is actually King Krichevskoy, who is Laharl's father.[/spoiler]

title: howto:romanize
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]
* "Overview":[#dtext-intro]
* "Disclaimer":[#dtext-disclaim]
* "Guidelines":[#dtext-guide]
* "Examples":[#dtext-example]
* "Mistakes to avoid":[#dtext-miss]
* "Briefly on non-Japanese languages":[#dtext-other]
* "Return":[#dtext-return]
[/expand]

h4#intro. Overview

Danbooru generally tries to use the original names of artists, characters and titles, but for practical reasons, like Japanese being gobbledygook to most of our users, they have to be represented in the Latin alphabet. For this Danbooru has its own set of romanization rules based on the [b]revised[/b] Hepburn romanization scheme.

These rules are used both for tagging and for translations.

The system is used here because it has been deemed practical for the community's needs. The main goal is [b]consistency[/b]; secondarily, to give a good idea of the original (hiragana and katakana) spellings and pronunciations.

h4#disclaim. DISCLAIMER
h6. Should any official romanization exist, they take precedence over this standard.

* See forum #168056 for details.
* Changing such romanized tags to a more "correct" version would be counterproductive for search usage.

The main difference between [b]Wikipedia[/b] romanizations and Danbooru romanizations is that Wikipedia uses macrons for certain long vowels (e.g. [i]seiyū[/i]), while Danbooru uses the so-called waapuro style (e.g. [i]seiyuu[/i]; see below).

For non-Japanese romanizations, scroll to the bottom.

h4#guide. General Guidelines

The key points of the Danbooru romanization standard:

* For basic "gojuuon":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goj%C5%ABon]: [i]し→shi, ち→chi, つ→tsu, ふ→fu[/i].
* For basic "youon":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Y%C5%8Don]: [i]きゃ→kya, しゃ→sha, ちゃ→cha, にゃ→nya, ひゃ→hya, みゃ→mya, りゃ→rya[/i] (etc., symmetrically).
* For gojuuon with (han)dakuten: [i]ざ→za, じ→ji, ず→zu[/i] (etc.).
**  づ and ず both become [i]zu[/i], while ぢ and じ both become [i]ji[/i].
* For youon with (han)dakuten: [i]じゃ→ja[/i] (etc.).
* ん becomes [i]n[/i], unless followed by a vowel or a [i]y-[/i] sound, in which case it becomes [i]n'[/i]: [i]せんかん → senkan, にんい → nin'i, じゅんや → jun'ya[/i].
* Long vowels follow their hiragana spellings:  [i]えい→ei, おう→ou, おお→oo, とお→too, ゆう→yuu[/i] (etc.).
** "ー":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ch%C5%8Donpu is to be replaced by doubling the preceding vowel, e.g. [i]ハー→haa[/i].
* Gemination, marked with a "sokuon":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sokuon symbol (っ in hiragana and ッ in katakana), is shown by doubling the consonant: きっと → [i]kitto[/i], いっぱい → [i]ippai[/i], ほっかい → [i]hokkai[/i].
** If a consonant sound is represented by a digraph, only the first letter is doubled: エッチ → [i]ecchi[/i], いっしょ → [i]issho[/i], みっつ → [i]mittsu[/i].
* When used as a topical particle, は becomes [i]wa[/i]. When used as a lative particle, へ becomes [i]e[/i]. を remains [i]wo[/i] in all contexts.
* Japanese names are generally written in Japanese-style "Surname Given-name" order. For details, see "the passage on name order under tagging help":/help/tags.

For anything not covered by these rules, follow the "revised Hepburn romanization system":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hepburn_romanization.

These romanization rules have been worked out as the site grew, and there are still many tags that are not compliant with the guidelines. If you spot any poorly romanized tags, please post a message in the forum.

h4#example. Examples

* あずまんが大王 → あずまんがだいおう → Danbooru: [i]Azumanga Daiou[/i], [b]Official: [[Azumanga Daioh]][/b].
* イリヤスフィール・フォン・アインツベルン → [[Illyasviel von Einzbern]].  [b]For non-Japanese or outright made-up proper names, use their official spellings where possible.[/b]
* 幻想郷 → げんそうきょう → [[Gensokyo]].
* 天王 はるか → てんおう はるか → [[Ten'ou Haruka]].  (The apostrophe is needed here to distinguish てんおう from てのう.)
* 遠坂 凛 → とおさか りん → Danbooru: [i]Toosaka Rin[/i], [b]Official: [[Tohsaka Rin]][/b].
* 葉月 → はづき → "Hazuki":/users/615.
* 魔法少女リリカルなのは → まほうしょうじょリリカルなのは → [[Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha]]. [b]For foreign words like[/b] [i]lyrical[/i], [b]follow the spellings of their respective source languages.[/b]
** ランドセル → [[randoseru]]. As an exception to the above, [b]loanwords whose semantics have changed in the borrowing process are often romanized as if they were Japanese.[/b]

h4#miss. Mistakes to avoid

* [i]とおの → toono[/i], [b]not[/b] [i]*tono, *tōno, *tohno[/i] or [i]*touno[/i].  Watch out for style differences like this when referencing other sources, [b]unless the official romanization says [i]tohno[/i][/b].
* [i]ゆうか → yuuka[/i], [b]not[/b] [i]*yuka[/i] or [i]*yūka[/i].  Long vowels again, [b]unless the official romanization says [i]yuka[/i][/b].

h4#other. Briefly on non-Japanese languages

For other languages, the same guidelines and principles mentioned apply, focusing on official/standard/common romanizations first, due to recognizability, and consistency second.

For Chinese, "pinyin":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pinyin] is the preferred means of romanization. However, diacritic marks are not used in tags, so they must be dropped (e.g. using [[Beijing]], if rendered in pinyin with its diacritics, it would be [i]Běijīng[/i]). If any further information is required on the given Chinese characters present, utilize a resource such as "Wiktionary":[https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E9%AC%BC] or the "Chinese Text Project":[https://ctext.org/dictionary.pl?if=en&char=%E9%AC%BC].

For Korean, the "Revised Romanization":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Revised_Romanization_of_Korean] used in South Korea is the preferred means of romanization. For Korean names, unless a specific romanized spelling is provided, utilize the most common spelling as used by resources such as Wikipedia.

For Cyrillic, user discretion is advised, as romanization standards vary across the various languages which make use of Cyrillic. As such, focus on identifying the language rather than relying on the script itself. The most common means of romanization for each Cyrillic-using language is preferred, which can be found on Wikipedia.

In several languages which utilize the Latin alphabet, in contrast to English, there is regular use of diacritics (e.g. German). While in some languages there are standardized means of transcribing these diacritics as to retain the word's original spelling (e.g. Ä as Ae), in others there are not, and will involve dropping the diacritics to render their words in an environment where they cannot be accessed. User discretion is advised on how to handle diacritics at a given moment.

h4#return. Go Back

* "Return to Notes and Translations":[/help/toc#dtext-notes_and_translations]
* "Return to the Table of Contents":[/help/toc]
* "Return to the Wiki Help Home Page":[/help/home]

title: sena_izumi_(ensemble_stars!)
body:
[i][[Ensemble Stars!]][/i] character. A third year student and member of [[knights (ensemble stars!)|Knights]]. He was the substitute leader for a while until the return of [[tsukinaga leo|Leo Tsukinaga]].

He has [[short hair|short]] [[silver hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. At school, he wears the standard [[yumenosaki school uniform|Yumenosaki uniform]], consisting on [[plaid pants]], a [[blazer]] with a [[vest]] and [[necktie]]. For Knights, he wears [[black gloves]], [[striped pants]] and a [[white shirt]] with [[epaulettes]].

Foul-mouthed and not honest with himself, Izumi has a big attitude, is full of confidence, and assumes a detached attitude towards the world at large. He used to be a popular model, but went on hiatus and entered the school in order to start over as an idol. He's fond of fellow former model [[yuuki makoto (ensemble stars!)|Makoto Yuuki]] but dismissive of anyone else.

Izumi initially considers [[anzu (ensemble stars!)|Anzu]] an amateur producer and a rival in his affections for Makoto. In later stories however, he learns Anzu and Makoto's relationship is nothing to worry about and begins recognizing her skills as a producer.

title: you_should_kill_yourself_now_(meme)
body:
A notorious [[meme]] based off of infamous FGC streamer [[Low Tier God]], in which he has particular enunciation of the tag's phrase, directed at an alleged stream sniper.

Over time, this would go on to spawn photoshopped versions of LTG, with [[glowing eyes]], channeling [[lightning]], and the tag's phrase being included in the picture, with "NOW!" being noticeably larger than the rest of the phrase. To circumvent automatic censorship algorithms, the phrase is sometimes omitted with only the photo, glowing eyes and lightning hinting at the suicide baiting.

* !asset #23117095

h4.External links

title: new_year
body:
An image relating to the first day of the new year on the Gregorian calendar.

It's a tradition for many Japanese artists to celebrate the new year by drawing girls clad in expensive [[kimono]], eating [[zouni soup]], carrying [[hamaya]] (a [[Shinto]] ward against evil and bad luck) and playing [[hanetsuki]]. 

Many artists also pay tribute to the [[Chinese zodiac]] by incorporating whatever animal corresponds to the year. It should be noted that the Chinese new year is not on January 1 of the Gregorian calendar, but instead varies from one year to the next (falling in either late January or early February). The year of the horse, for example, begins January 31, 2014. Despite this, images utilizing the animal of an upcoming Chinese New Year tend to begin appearing around January 1, as Japan uses the same zodiac but does not use the Chinese Lunar calendar. 

The typical way of telling if an image is celebrating the New Year is by the phrase 謹賀新年 ([i]kinga shinnen[/i], literally "happy new year") or by one or both of the more traditional greeting exchanges (shortened as [[akeome]] and [[kotoyoro]]). It is also common for New Year images to include [[Happy New Year]] in English text, and/or the number of the year. Text indicating a new year related image may also be absent from the image itself but present in Pixiv tags/artist commentary, website text, etc. 

h4. List of Chinese zodiac years

* [[year of the rat]]
* [[year of the ox]]
* [[year of the tiger]]
* [[year of the rabbit]]
* [[year of the dragon]]
* [[year of the snake]]
* [[year of the horse]]
* [[year of the goat]]
* [[year of the monkey]]
* [[year of the rooster]]
* [[year of the dog]]
* [[year of the pig]]

h4. See also

* [[hanetsuki]] (badminton-like New Year's game)
* [[hatsumoude]] (first shrine visit of the New Year)
* [[hatsuyume]] (first dream of the New Year)

* [[otoshidama]] (gift of money given to children)

* [[omamori]] (pouch-shaped amulets sold at shrines)

* Spear
* [I]Grindhouse[/I] - [[Crippler Crossface]], sometimes combined with a [[sleeper hold]].
** [I]Glasgow Grin[/I] - An illegal variant where a broken metal rod from a [[folding chair]] is used for leverage.
* [I]Con-chair-to[/I] - A tag team, double [[folding chair]] sandwiching attack to an opponent's head. 
** [I]One Man Con-chair-to[/I] - A single version, where the prone opponent's head is placed onto a closed folding chair and then the user of this move delivers a chair shot onto the former's head, mimicking the sandwiching part of the original, tag team version.

title: crying_wojak
body:
A variant of [[Wojak]] featuring the character [[crying with eyes open]] out of frustration. Typically used interchangeably with [[Soyjak]]s to depict the stereotypical hardcore fandoms/group when they seems to cannot counter an argument.

A popular version of this variant feature the crying Wojak wearing a [[mask]] of their [[smug]] face. This is used to point out someone who still maintains apparent façade of superiority even when they are losing the argument.

title: nanatsu_no_taizai
body:
[b]Nanatsu no Taizai[/b] (七つの大罪, lit. [i]The Seven Deadly Sins[/i]) is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by [[Suzuki Nakaba]]. It has been serialized in [[Kodansha]]'s Weekly Shounen Magazine since October 2012. The manga features a setting similar to the European Middle Ages, with its titular group of knights representing the seven deadly sins. The series was continued with the next-generation manga [i][[Mokushiroku no Yonkishi]][/i].

Not to be confused with the [[The Seven Deadly Sins]], another series by the same name.

title: shin_getter_robo
body:
The fourth manga released in the [[Getter Robo]] Saga, Shin Getter Robo (otherwise known as Change Getter Robo) is an interquel that takes place between [[Getter Robo G]] and [[Getter Robo Go]]. Ran from 1996 to 1999.

The series was loosely adapted into an OVA in 1998, titled [b]Shin!! Getter Robo: Sekai Saigo no Hi[/b] (known as [b]Getter Robo Armageddon[/b] in English). The adaptation also incorporates elements of other installments in the Getter Saga, as well as elements from some of Ishikawa Ken's non-Getter works.

The titular mecha also appears prominently in [[Shin Getter Robo vs Neo Getter Robo]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Shin Getter Robo":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Getter_Robo#Shin_Getter_Robo]

title: amy_(huffslove)
body: Amy is an original character created by artist [[huffslove]] for the Tome of Imps series. Originally a human scholar, she was sent the Tome of Imps by her friend [[diana_(huffslove)|Diana]] at the conclusion of "Diana's own experiences with the Tome":[/pools/24453]. After initially berating Diana for recklessly using lewd magical items, she too eventually eventually becomes one of many imps inhabiting the Tome, appearing in later comics and 1-shots. It is suggested that much of her 'research material' might actually be smut, lewd toys, etc.

title: diana_(huffslove)
body: Diana is an original character created by artist [[huffslove]] for the Tome of Imps series. Originally a human adventurer, she discovered the Tome of Imps in a dungeon during "the first comic to feature her":[/pools/24453], and was slowly turned into an imp as well due to the magical influence of the book. She's now just one of many imps inhabiting the Tome, and appears in other comics and 1-shots as well. She was a good friend of [[amy_(huffslove)|Amy]] before her adventure, and mailed the Tome to her after turning into an imp.

title: alpharius_omegon
body:
[[Warhammer 40K]] character. [[Primarch]](s) of the [[Alpha Legion]].

"Twin" primarch who were split in two, known as either Alpharius Omegon as one individual, or Alpharius and Omegon as two separate individuals.

h6. Wargear and other commonly used tags: 
(Text taken from https://wh40k.lexicanum.com. Tags added.)

[quote]Typical of the Alpha Legion's nature, Alpharius and Omegon utilized completely non-standard and inconsistent wargear and even the Primarch himself did not typically engage in open combat. He often preferred using Cameleoline-lined cloaks and armour that partially cloaked the wearer. However, Alpharius and Omegon were observed utilizing reptilian-style [[Power_armor|Power_Armour]] known as [[The_Pythian_Scales]].[7] One of his stranger reported weapons was the Xenos artifact known as [[the_Pale_Spear_(warhammer)|the_Pale_Spear]], and a Plasma Weapon known as The Hydra's Spite. Alpharius Omegon was also seen with Power [[Holding_sword|Sword]]s, Power [[Holding_polearm|Spears]], and Plasma [[Holding_gun|Guns]] in combat situations.[3]

Omegon possesses a suit of [[grey_armor|grey]] power armour that he keeps hidden from everyone, including his brother Alpharius.[9] Though if one takes into consideration Alpharius' dubious tale of being the first rediscovered Primarch, this suit may have belonged to him instead of the later-discovered Omegon.[17f]   [/quote]
other_names: アルファリウス=オメゴン

title: jaghatai_khan
body:
[[Warhammer 40K]] character. [[Primarch]] of the [[White Scars]].

h6. Wargear and other commonly used tags: 
(Text taken from https://wh40k.lexicanum.com. Tags added.)

[quote]During the Heresy, Jaghatai Khan is seen wielding a Talwar-shaped Power [[Sword]] and wearing a helm that resembled a snarling beast.[4] His more famous wargear consisted of the [[White_Tiger_Dao]], [[Wildfire_Panoply]], Archaeotech Pistol known as [[Storm's_Voice]], and Sojutsu Pattern Voidbike[/quote]

title: vulkan
body: [[Warhammer 40K]] character. [[Primarch]] of the [[Salamanders (warhammer)|]].

title: perturabo
body:
[[Warhammer 40K]] character. [[Primarch]] of the IVth [[adeptus_astartes|Legiones Astartes]], the [[Iron Warriors]].

h6. Wargear and other commonly used tags: 
(Text taken from https://wh40k.lexicanum.com. Tags added.)

[quote]Perturabo's primary weapon during the Heresy was the [[thunder_hammer|Thunder Hammer]] [[Forgebreaker]], a weapon that had previously belonged to [[ferrus_manus|Ferrus Manus]] before being given to him as a gift by [[fulgrim|Fulgrim]].[7] For protection, Perturabo wore a highly modified suit of Cataphractii Pattern [[terminator_armor|Terminator Armour]] known as [[The Logos]]. One of the most advanced suits of its age, it was equipped with a wide variety of support systems as well as a Teleport beacon. The Logos was also equipped with a pair of four-barreled wrist-mounted cannons.[9] On the battlefield, Perturabo would sometimes ride a modified Shadowsword known as Tormentor. [/quote]

title: lorgar_aurelian

title: leman_russ
body:
[[Warhammer 40K]] character. [[Primarch]] of the [[Space Wolves]].

h6. Wargear and other commonly used tags: 
(Text taken from https://wh40k.lexicanum.com. Tags added.)

[quote]Leman Russ's primary weapon during the Horus Heresy was the Frostblade [[Mjalnar]], an ancient weapon also known as the Sword of Balenight. Prior to taking up Mjalnar he wielded the [[chainsword]] [[Krakenmaw]] until it was destroyed by Angron during the Night of the Wolf. To complement his sword, Russ also wielded the frost [[battle_axe|axe]] [[Helwinter]].[22] For longer-ranged engagements, Russ wielded the [[combi-bolter|bolter]] [[Scornspitter]]. Russ is also known to have had an artifact known as the [[Spear_of_Russ]], but he hated the weapon and ultimately gave it to Bjorn during the Battle of Yarant.[21]

For protection, Russ wore a singular suit of artificer [[power_armor|armour]] known as [[the Armour Elavagar]].[23][/quote]

title: corvus_corax_(warhammer)
body:
[[Warhammer 40K]] character. [[Primarch]] of the [[Raven Guard]].

h6. Wargear and other commonly used tags: 
(Text taken from https://wh40k.lexicanum.com. Tags added.)

[quote]In battle, Corax favoured a Heavy [[Bolter]] for long-range killing, which he hefted and aimed as easily as an ordinary man would lift a battle rifle. He wielded two Archeotech [[pistol]]s as additional firepower. For close quarters fighting he carried a three-headed Power [[Whip]] specially crafted for him by the [[adeptus_mechanicus|Adeptus Mechanicus]] as well as a pair of [[lightning_claws|Lightning Claws]] known as [[the_Raven's_Talons_(warhammer)|The Raven's Talons]]. In the absence of these weapons, he was more than able to tear apart enemies with his bare hands.[6] Corax wore a jet-black suit of [[Power_Armor|Power Armour]] known as [[The_Sable_Armor|The Sable Armour]] which incorporated an advanced Jump Pack known as the [[Korvidine Pinions]]. The Sable Armour was also capable of masking his energy signature and could be used to jam nearby enemy communications.[7]

Corax's most potent ability, however, was his "wraith-slip", also called a Shadow-Slip or Shadow-Walk. This allowed him to seemingly meld with the shadows around him, disappearing from the view of his foes before striking unseen.[8] Following his reappearance sometime after the Heresy, Corax became empowered by the Warp itself. Able to contend with the Daemon Primarch [[lorgar_aurelian|Lorgar]], Corax is now capable of transforming himself into shadows, darkness, and unkindnesses of ravens.[13]  [/quote]

Misc. appearance tags: [[black_armor]], [[black_hair]], [[animal_skull]], [[animal_skull_ornament]], [[bird_skull]], [[long_hair]], [[power_armor]], [[the_sable_armor]]
other_names: コルウス・コラックス

title: angron
body:
[[Warhammer 40K]] character. [[Primarch]] of the [[World Eaters]].

h6. Wargear and other commonly used tags: 
(Text taken from https://wh40k.lexicanum.com. Tags added.)

[quote]During the Great Crusade and Horus Heresy, Angron wielded the twin [[Chain_Axe]]s [[Gorechild]] and [[Gorefather]]. Before these twin weapons, he wielded the primitive Chainaxe [[Widowmaker_weapon|Widowmaker]], which was broken in battle against Leman Russ during the Night of the Wolf. To replace it, Angron took up the massive [[battle_axe|axe]] [[Brazentooth]], which was eventually given to the Word Bearers as a sign of their alliance.[17] For protection, Angron wore a massive suit of Power Armour designed from his Nucerian [[gladiator|gladiatorial]] armor known as [[the_Armour_of_Mars|the Armor of Mars]]. Angron also wielded the Plasma [[Pistol]] [[Spite_Furnace|Spite Furnace]].[16] Upon becoming a Daemon Prince, Angron abandoned most of his mortal weaponry, taking up the Daemon Weapon known as the [[Black_Blade_(warhammer)|Black Blade]].

Since his recent return to the Materium, Angron has taken up the Daemon Weapon [[Samni'arius]] and [[Chain_Axe]] [[Spinegrinder]].[30]  [/quote]
